content.p: Anyone who employs or permits or suffers any minor to be employed or to work in violation of to or of any order or ruling issued under the provisions thereof, or obstructs the Department of Workplace Standards, its officers, or agents, or any other person authorized to inspect places of employment under to or anyone who, having under his or her control or custody any minor, permits or suffers him or her to be employed or to work in violation of to or who sells to a minor any article with the knowledge that the minor intends to sell the article in violation of to shall be assessed a civil penalty, in accordance with the provisions of , of not less than one hundred dollars ($100) nor more than one thousand dollars ($1,000). Every employer who continues to employ a minor in violation of to after he has been notified by the Department of Workplace Standards, its officers or agents, shall be assessed a civil penalty, in accordance with the provisions of , of one hundred dollars ($100) for each day the violation continues and the employment of any minor in violation of to shall with respect to each minor so employed constitute a separate and distinct offense.
